usage.description:
fedtools config set <key> <value>
 fedtools config delete <key>
 fedtools config list
 fedtools config reset

messages.set: Key '%{key}' updated to '%{value}' in configuration file.
messages.reset: Fedtools configuration was reset to default values.

error.unableToRead: Unable to read the configuration file...
error.suggestion: You may want to check if it is a valid JSON format?

help.description:
Fedtools comes with a default set of configurations that can be updated via this utility. For example, you can update the default folder that is going to be used to clone WF-RIA.
The following keys are accepted:
browser, defaultbranch, localrepo, jenkinshostname, jenkinsusername, userbranch, useremail, username, wria2gitfolder, wria2giturl, wria2yui3giturl,  yuibranch
help.examples:
fedtools config list
fedtools config set browser "Google Chrome"
fedtools config set browser "Safari"
fedtools config set browser "Firefox"
fedtools config delete browser # revert back to default browser
fedtools config reset

1.desc: Use this command to print out the full configuration file.

2.desc: Use this command to set a key to a value in the configuration file.

3.desc: Use this command to delete the key from the configuration file.

4.desc: Use this command to reset the configuration file to the default values.
